column4: Hi everyone. I have a problem with Amarok on Ubuntu 10.04 - it's process stays active when I quit it from menu or on Ctrl+Q, so to start it again, I have to kill the process and then start it. Also, it doesn't appear in Applications > Sound and video, and I've installed it via the terminal, from the repos. Any ideas on how to fix this? Thank you.
but before do apt-get purge amarok to remove the left files
So, i first purge it, and then reinstall?
strange, this amarok ;) it's from the universe repo?
How can I check that to be sure? I guess it is, but I'm not 100% sure.
Want me to paste it to pastebin so you can see? I've added the Multisystem, Tor and PyOpenCL repos...
then do a sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get purge amarok && sudo apt-get install amarok
then must be a problem with your system
Damn... Okay, thanks for your help anyway!
I u really wanna try u can download the source and compile
Its a prev. step to download it from upstream :)
